title: 23.1 Growing a Minimum Spanning Tree
content:
Section 23.1

Growing a Minimum Spanning Tree

Summary

Generic MST algorithm: grow tree edge by edge using safe edges.

Key Points

  • MST connects all vertices with minimum total edge weight
  • Generic approach: maintain set A of edges, add safe edges
  • Safe edge: adding it keeps A a subset of some MST
  • Cut property: lightest edge crossing any cut is safe
  • A cut (S, V-S) respects A if no edge of A crosses it

Example

Start with empty A. Find any cut, add its lightest crossing edge. Repeat until tree complete.

Why It Matters

Framework for understanding Kruskal and Prim algorithms.
